meanings.definition: To crouch or shrink back in fear or shame.
meanings.sent1: The scared puppy was cowering in the corner.
meanings.sent2: The cat was cowering under the bed during the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse was cowering from the big, bad cat.
meanings.sent4: The flowers were cowering under the heavy raindrops.
meanings.sent5: The child was cowering behind their mother during the loud fireworks.

meanings.definition: Showing fear or submissiveness by cowering.
meanings.sent1: The cowering dog looked up with sad eyes.
meanings.sent2: The cowering student avoided making eye contact with the teacher.
meanings.sent3: The cowering kitten quickly ran away from the playful puppy.
meanings.sent4: The cowering rabbit froze in place as the fox approached.
meanings.sent5: The cowering squirrel stayed still, hoping not to be noticed by the hawk.
